image_1.merged_entity_name: DIACHRONIC WORD EMBEDDINGS AND SEMANTIC SHIFTS DETECTION
image_1.description: Diachronic word embeddings and semantic shifts detection is the main topic of the paper, focusing on tracing temporal changes in lexical semantics, particularly using prediction-based word embedding models like word2vec. This research area lacks cohesion and common terminology, with various terms such as 'temporal embeddings,' 'diachronic embeddings,' and 'dynamic embeddings' being used by different research communities.
source_image_entities: LOCAL MEASURES BETTER FOR CULTURAL SHIFTS
source_text_entities: DIACHRONIC WORD EMBEDDINGS AND SEMANTIC SHIFTS DETECTION

image_1.description: The Google Ngrams Corpus is a large database of words and phrases compiled by Google, introduced in 2011, and has played a significant role in the development of the field of studying semantic shifts and 'culturomics'. It is used by various researchers, including Michel et al., to study human culture through digital media.
The Corpus of Historical American English (COHA) is a large corpus of texts used for studying historical changes in language, including diachronic semantic shifts.
The NYT Corpus is a corpus of texts from the New York Times, used for various linguistic studies, including the analysis of diachronic semantic shifts.
The GIGAWORD Corpus is a large corpus of news articles used for various linguistic studies, including the analysis of diachronic semantic shifts.
